To be fair. Wow is a HIGHLY optimized in its cpu usage. League on the other hand is not.

It really isn't. WoW is an old game running on an old engine and it _shows_. A lot of new content is relatively laggy in terms of particle effects that are the literal limit of what the engine is capable of. The reason it doesn't use much resource a lot of the time is that the game was designed to be ran on PCs from 10 years ago.

Blizzard games as a whole tend to be bloated on file size and perform relatively poorly. Diablo 3 is the main exception to this and Heroes of the Storm has got to be the worse offender on the performance front.

Sorry but there's something wrong with your hardware settings. WoW is a REALLY outdated example btw. If it's overheating, you have something that should have been thrown out about 7 years ago and probably was built for Windows XP/Vista, not 7-10, because 7-10 OS's optimize well enough that League only needs 1-2 processor bays.

> [{quoted}](name=Illabethe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jTmMTtLT,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2020-01-24T19:28:32.550+0000)
>
> Sorry but there's something wrong with your hardware settings. WoW is a REALLY outdated example btw. If it's overheating, you have something that should have been thrown out about 7 years ago and probably was built for Windows XP/Vista, not 7-10, because 7-10 OS's optimize well enough that League only needs 1-2 processor bays.

If by "processor bays" you mean "CPU cores," LoL only _does_ use one core for most of the work. It's not about how much it "needs," it's about what it's capable of. If that one core can put out 200 FPS, it'll do so. If it can only handle 20 FPS, that's what you get, while the other cores mostly just sit there.
Any Processor after 2013 or so is a reworked Gen i7-i9, which can clock minimum 90 FPS running league. If it's running less, it's overheating due to poor construction/wear/tear.

> [{quoted}](name=Illabethe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jTmMTtLT,comment-id=000800000000,timestamp=2020-01-24T22:37:27.237+0000)
>
> Any Processor after 2013 or so is a reworked Gen i7-i9, which can clock minimum 90 FPS running league. If it's running less, it's overheating due to poor construction/wear/tear.

Yes, but that stuff about "only needs 1-2 processor bays" (again, assuming you meant that LoL only uses one to two CPU cores) is not specific to a particular processor. Someone with a dual-core CPU is going to see LoL use one core for most of its work plus a bit of activity in the other. Someone with an octa-core CPU... is going to see LoL use one core for most of its work plus a bit of activity in another. Low end, high end, it doesn't matter. LoL isn't going to use more than one core for most of its work.
